mentions.context: Optimal Transport (OT) has become increasingly popular in diverse NLP applications, as it allows comparing probability distributions in a geometrically sound manner.
PretRand: This is a transfer learning strategy proposed by Meftah et al. (2021) for low-resource domain adaptation.
CE kNN + + SRC: This is the Cross-Encoderbased neighborhood framework kNN + , proposed by Sarwar et al. ( 2022), as discussed in Section 2.2.
For CE kNN + + SRC, we perform experiments with the implementation provided to us by the authors and report the results for the neighborhood size of 10 in Table 2.
We implement PretRand ourselves following the description provided by Meftah et al. (2021).
We first train CE kNN + on the source (SRC) and then with the target instances and their neighbors from the source.
The baselines of Mixed-FT, kNN variants and CE kNN + achieve significant improvements compared to the vanilla Seq-FT for only 1 case, and Pre-tRand achieves it for 2 cases.

Such optimization can be efficiently performed using Optimal Transport (OT) (Peyré and Cuturi, 2019;Villani, 2009;Kantorovich, 2006) due to its ability to find correspondences between instances while exploiting the underlying geometry of the embedding space.

For this, we incorporate neighborhood information with Optimal Transport (OT), as OT can learn correspondences between instances from X s train and X t train by exploiting the underlying embedding space geometry.
In particular, we incorporate neighborhood information with Optimal Transport, which permits exploiting the geometry of the data embedding space.
Recently, Sarwar et al. (2022) propose a neighborhood framework kNN + for transfer learning in cross-lingual low-resource settings.
To the best of our knowledge, this is the first work that introduces Optimal Transport for HS detection.
CE kNN + + SRC: This is the Cross-Encoderbased neighborhood framework kNN + , proposed by Sarwar et al. ( 2022), as discussed in Section 2.2.
We use a batch size of 32 for the OT N N and the baselines, except CE-kNN + .

In their best performing framework (in crosslingual setting) of Cross-Encoder kNN + , Sarwar et al. ( 2022) obtain representations of concatenated query-neighbor pairs to learn such neighborhood interactions.
• We propose novel incorporation of neighborhood information with joint distribution Optimal Transport.
For computing γ, we use the entropic regularized unbalanced OT solver using the Python Optimal Transport package 4 (Flamary et al., 2021) at the mini-batch level.
For computing γ, we use the entropic regularized unbalanced OT solver using the Python Optimal Transport package 4 (Flamary et al., 2021) at the mini-batch level.
This can be done by extracting the cross-lingual neighbors using multilingual sentence embedding models like LaBSE (Feng et al., 2022).
In this work, we proposed a framework for transferring knowledge to a low-resource HS corpus by incorporating neighborhood information with Optimal Transport.
